author: Staff Reporter
text:
Minister For Adi Dravidar And Tribal Welfare N. Subramanian distrubuting welfare assistance to a beneficiary in Thoothukudi on Friday.— Photo: N. Rajesh

Welfare assistance to the tune of Rs. 8.17 lakh was provided to 54 beneficiaries through Adi Dravidar and Tribal Welfare department at the valedictory programme of Humanity Week here on Friday. N. Subramanian,

Minister for Adi Dravidar and Tribal Welfare extended the benefits in the presence of S.P. Shunmuganathan, Tourism Minister.

Enrolment up

He said the enrolment of Adi Dravidar students, who pursue higher education, rose to 4,59, 582 in 2014-15 from 2,74,454 students in 2010.

The subsidy given under the TAHDCO scheme by the State government for the economic development of the Adi Dravidar community had witnessed a nine fold increase to 2.25 lakh from 25,000.

Among beneficiaries under free cattle distribution scheme, 29 percent of scheme benefits reached the Adi Dravidar community, the Minister said.

S. Siva Shanmugaraja, Director, Adi Dravidar and Tribal Welfare and others were present.
title: Minister distributes welfare assistance
